WRONG!!! There is NOTHING wrong with it do you really think I would go to all the trouble of recording and capturing and uploading almost a 6 hour show that is 8.48 GB if there was something wrong with it? HELL NO!!! That would be a waste of my bandwidth to do that!!!

PLEASE READ BELOW:

To ensure that you can get proper playback be sure you have installed the K-lite codec pack full version or mega version both of which comes with Media Player Classic Home Cinema and configure it properly for .mkv playback. If you do not have it you can get it here below: 

http://www.free-codecs.com/download/K_Lite_Codec_Pack.htm 

Once installed you can playback the .mkv file with the following players:

Media Player Classic, Power DVD, or Windows Media Player. 

VLC player doesn't play the MKV video only the audio for some unknown reason, so use the above players or you can burn the .mkv video file to 2 DVD -R  discs or load it onto a USB flash drive and play it back on any BluRay player that is MKV compatible and has a USB port like my Panasonic DMP BD75 BluRay player and LG BP620 3D BluRay player does.

SCSA420 Thank you for the upload.
I was able to get this mkv to play in VLC  ver 2.0.4 Windows 7 ultimate 64bit

http://wiki.videolan.org/WindowsFAQ-2.0.x#H.264.2FMPEG-4_AVC_playback_is_too_slow_.28or_laggy.29

You can speed up the H.264/MPEG-4 AVC playback by disabling loop filter for H.264 decoding. To do this go to Tools -> Preferences and Input / Codecs and in the drop-down box for Skip H.264 in-loop deblocking filter change it to All. Remember to press Save to save VLC settings and restart VLC after that to make sure changes are enabled.
Also if you have multicore CPU (or one with Intel Hyper-Threading), you can lower the FFMPEG thread count. To do this go to Tools -> Preferences (Show settings: All), then Input / Codecs -> Video codecs -> FFmpeg, then locate Threads, and set it to 4 (or to 2, or to 1). Remember to press Save to save VLC settings and restart VLC after that to make sure changes are enabled.

Maybe SCSA420 can include this in future upload descriptions depending successful comments.

Please comment if this works for you
